storyTitle: As Employee, I want to securely log in to the schedule system to achieve personalized schedule access

testCases.title: Validate successful login with valid credentials
preconditions: Employee account exists in the system with valid credentials
Employee account is active and not locked
Login page is accessible via HTTPS
Browser is supported (Chrome, Firefox, Safari, Edge)
Network connectivity is stable

steps.action: Open web browser and navigate to the login page URL
steps.expectedResult: Login page loads successfully displaying username field, password field, login button, and 'Forgot Password' link

steps.action: Enter valid username in the username field
steps.expectedResult: Username is accepted and displayed in the field without validation errors

steps.action: Enter valid password in the password field
steps.expectedResult: Password is masked with dots or asterisks and no validation errors are shown

steps.action: Click the 'Login' button to submit the login form
steps.expectedResult: System processes authentication within 2 seconds, user is authenticated successfully, and redirected to the schedule dashboard with personalized greeting or username displayed

steps.action: Verify the schedule dashboard displays correctly
steps.expectedResult: Schedule dashboard loads with employee-specific data, navigation menu is visible, and session is established

postconditions: User is logged in with active session
User has access to schedule dashboard
Login attempt is logged in audit trail
Session timeout timer is initiated

testCases.title: Verify rejection of invalid login attempts
preconditions: Employee account exists in the system
Employee account is active and not currently locked
Login page is accessible
Account lockout policy is configured for 5 failed attempts

steps.action: Navigate to the login page URL
steps.expectedResult: Login form is displayed with username field, password field, and login button

steps.action: Enter valid username and incorrect password in the respective fields
steps.expectedResult: Fields accept the input without client-side validation errors

steps.action: Click the 'Login' button to submit the form
steps.expectedResult: System displays error message 'Invalid username or password' and user remains on login page. Failed attempt counter increments to 1

steps.action: Enter valid username and incorrect password again
steps.expectedResult: Fields accept the input

steps.action: Click the 'Login' button to submit the form (2nd attempt)
steps.expectedResult: System displays error message 'Invalid username or password' and user remains on login page. Failed attempt counter increments to 2

steps.action: Repeat login attempt with valid username and incorrect password (3rd attempt)
steps.expectedResult: System displays error message 'Invalid username or password'. Failed attempt counter increments to 3

steps.action: Repeat login attempt with valid username and incorrect password (4th attempt)
steps.expectedResult: System displays error message 'Invalid username or password'. Failed attempt counter increments to 4

steps.action: Repeat login attempt with valid username and incorrect password (5th attempt)
steps.expectedResult: System displays error message 'Your account has been locked due to multiple failed login attempts. Please contact administrator or use password recovery' and account is locked. User cannot proceed to login

steps.action: Attempt to login with correct credentials for the locked account
steps.expectedResult: System displays message 'Your account is locked. Please contact administrator or use password recovery' and denies access

postconditions: User account is locked after 5 failed attempts
All failed login attempts are logged in audit trail
User notification is triggered (email/SMS if configured)
User remains on login page without access to system

testCases.title: Test password recovery workflow
preconditions: Employee account exists with registered email address
Email service is configured and operational
Login page is accessible
Password recovery feature is enabled

steps.action: Navigate to the login page URL
steps.expectedResult: Login form is displayed with 'Forgot Password' link visible below or near the login button

steps.action: Click on the 'Forgot Password' link
steps.expectedResult: User is redirected to password recovery page displaying email input field and submit button with instructions 'Enter your registered email address to receive password reset instructions'

steps.action: Enter valid registered email address in the email field
steps.expectedResult: Email address is accepted and displayed in the field with proper email format validation

steps.action: Click the 'Submit' or 'Send Reset Link' button
steps.expectedResult: System displays confirmation message 'Password reset instructions have been sent to your email address' and processes the request within 2 seconds

steps.action: Check the registered email inbox for password reset email
steps.expectedResult: Password reset email is received within 5 minutes containing reset link, instructions, and expiration time (typically 24 hours)

steps.action: Click the password reset link in the email
steps.expectedResult: User is redirected to password reset page with fields for new password and confirm password, along with password complexity requirements displayed

postconditions: Password reset email is sent successfully
Password reset token is generated and stored
Password recovery attempt is logged in audit trail
User can proceed to reset password using the link

storyTitle: As Employee, I want to view my daily schedule to achieve clear understanding of my work shifts

testCases.title: Validate daily schedule display with accurate shift details
preconditions: Employee account is created and active
Employee has valid login credentials
Employee has at least one shift scheduled for the current day
Schedule data exists in the database
User is not currently logged in

steps.action: Navigate to the login page and enter valid employee credentials (username and password)
steps.expectedResult: Login is successful and user is redirected to the schedule dashboard within 2 seconds

steps.action: Verify the schedule dashboard loads completely
steps.expectedResult: Schedule dashboard is displayed with navigation options including 'Daily View', 'Weekly View', and other menu items. Current date is visible

steps.action: Click on 'Daily View' option or tab in the navigation menu
steps.expectedResult: Daily schedule view loads within 3 seconds displaying the current day's schedule with date prominently shown

steps.action: Review the displayed shift information for start time
steps.expectedResult: Shift start time is displayed in clear format (e.g., 09:00 AM) and matches the scheduled start time in the database

steps.action: Review the displayed shift information for end time
steps.expectedResult: Shift end time is displayed in clear format (e.g., 05:00 PM) and matches the scheduled end time in the database

steps.action: Verify the shift location information
steps.expectedResult: Shift location is clearly displayed (e.g., 'Building A - Floor 2' or 'Downtown Office') and matches database records

steps.action: Verify the shift role information
steps.expectedResult: Employee role for the shift is displayed (e.g., 'Cashier', 'Manager', 'Sales Associate') and matches database records

steps.action: Check for shift status indicator
steps.expectedResult: Shift status is displayed (e.g., 'Confirmed', 'Pending') with appropriate visual indicator (color or icon)

steps.action: Verify the current day is highlighted visually
steps.expectedResult: Current day is highlighted with distinct background color, border, or other visual emphasis to differentiate from other days

postconditions: User remains logged in with active session
Daily schedule view is displayed
All shift details are accurately shown
Page load time is within 3 seconds performance requirement

testCases.title: Verify access restriction to employee's own schedule
preconditions: Two employee accounts exist: Employee A and Employee B
Both employees have valid login credentials
Both employees have schedules assigned in the system
Role-based access control is configured
User is not currently logged in

steps.action: Navigate to login page and log in using Employee A's credentials (username and password)
steps.expectedResult: Employee A is successfully authenticated and redirected to schedule dashboard showing Employee A's schedule data

steps.action: Note the current URL in the browser address bar
steps.expectedResult: URL contains Employee A's identifier or session token (e.g., /schedule/employee/A or /schedule/daily?user=employeeA)

steps.action: Manually modify the URL to attempt accessing Employee B's schedule by changing the employee identifier in the URL (e.g., change employeeA to employeeB)
steps.expectedResult: System detects unauthorized access attempt and displays error message 'Access Denied: You do not have permission to view this schedule' or redirects to Employee A's own schedule

steps.action: Verify that Employee B's schedule data is not displayed
steps.expectedResult: No schedule information for Employee B is visible. Only error message or Employee A's schedule is shown

steps.action: Click logout button or link to end Employee A's session
steps.expectedResult: Employee A is logged out successfully and redirected to login page. Session is terminated

steps.action: Log in using Employee B's credentials (username and password)
steps.expectedResult: Employee B is successfully authenticated and redirected to schedule dashboard

steps.action: Verify the schedule dashboard displays Employee B's schedule
steps.expectedResult: Schedule dashboard loads within 3 seconds showing Employee B's personal schedule with correct shift details, location, and role information specific to Employee B

steps.action: Confirm that Employee A's schedule data is not visible to Employee B
steps.expectedResult: Only Employee B's schedule is displayed. No information about Employee A's shifts or schedule is visible

postconditions: Access control is enforced successfully
Unauthorized access attempt is logged in audit trail
Employee B is logged in with access to only their own schedule
Data privacy is maintained between employee accounts

storyTitle: As Employee, I want to view my weekly schedule to plan my workweek effectively

testCases.title: Validate weekly schedule display and navigation
preconditions: Employee account exists in the system with valid credentials
Employee has assigned shifts for current and next week
Schedule database is accessible and populated with shift data
Application is accessible via supported browser
Network connectivity is stable

steps.action: Navigate to the application login page and enter valid employee credentials (username and password), then click the Login button
steps.expectedResult: Employee is successfully authenticated and redirected to the schedule dashboard. Dashboard displays navigation options including weekly view option

steps.action: Click on or select the 'Weekly View' option from the schedule dashboard
steps.expectedResult: Current week's schedule is displayed showing all assigned shifts with start times, end times, and location details. Current week is visually highlighted. Page loads within 4 seconds

steps.action: Click on the 'Next Week' navigation button or arrow to move forward one week
steps.expectedResult: Next week's schedule is displayed accurately with all assigned shifts, start times, end times, and locations. Week dates update correctly. Navigation completes without errors. Page loads within 4 seconds

postconditions: Employee remains logged into the system
Weekly schedule view remains active and accessible
Next week's schedule data is displayed on screen
System maintains session state for further navigation

testCases.title: Verify schedule data access restriction
preconditions: Two employee accounts exist: Employee A and Employee B with valid credentials
Both employees have assigned shifts in the system
Employee B's schedule data exists in the database
Application enforces employee-specific data access security
Application is accessible via supported browser

steps.action: Navigate to the application login page and enter Employee A's valid credentials (username and password), then click the Login button
steps.expectedResult: Employee A is successfully authenticated and redirected to their schedule dashboard. Dashboard displays Employee A's schedule information and navigation options

steps.action: Attempt to access Employee B's weekly schedule by manipulating URL parameters, API calls, or any available navigation method to view another employee's schedule data
steps.expectedResult: Access is denied. System displays an error message indicating 'Access Denied' or 'You do not have permission to view this schedule'. Employee B's schedule data is not displayed. Employee A remains on their own schedule view or is redirected to an error page. Security log records the unauthorized access attempt

postconditions: Employee A remains logged in with access only to their own schedule
Employee B's schedule data remains protected and inaccessible to Employee A
System security logs record the access denial event
No unauthorized data exposure occurs

storyTitle: As Employee, I want to view my monthly schedule to have a long-term overview of my shifts

testCases.title: Validate monthly schedule display and navigation
preconditions: Employee account exists in the system with valid credentials
Employee has assigned shifts for current and next month
Schedule database is accessible and populated with monthly shift data
Application is accessible via supported browser
Network connectivity is stable

steps.action: Navigate to the application login page and enter valid employee credentials (username and password), then click the Login button
steps.expectedResult: Employee is successfully authenticated and redirected to the schedule dashboard. Dashboard displays navigation options including monthly view option

steps.action: Click on or select the 'Monthly View' option from the schedule dashboard
steps.expectedResult: Current month's schedule is displayed showing all assigned shifts with start times, end times, and location details. Current month is visually highlighted. Calendar format displays all days of the month. Page loads within 5 seconds

steps.action: Click on the 'Next Month' navigation button or arrow to move forward one month
steps.expectedResult: Next month's schedule is displayed accurately with all assigned shifts, start times, end times, and locations. Month and year update correctly. All dates for the next month are visible. Navigation completes without errors. Page loads within 5 seconds

postconditions: Employee remains logged into the system
Monthly schedule view remains active and accessible
Next month's schedule data is displayed on screen
System maintains session state for further navigation

testCases.title: Verify access restriction to employee's monthly schedule
preconditions: Two employee accounts exist: Employee A and Employee B with valid credentials
Both employees have assigned shifts in the system for the current month
Employee B's monthly schedule data exists in the database
Application enforces employee-specific data access security
Application is accessible via supported browser

steps.action: Navigate to the application login page and enter Employee A's valid credentials (username and password), then click the Login button
steps.expectedResult: Employee A is successfully authenticated and redirected to their schedule dashboard. Dashboard displays Employee A's schedule information and navigation options

steps.action: Attempt to access Employee B's monthly schedule by manipulating URL parameters, API calls, or any available navigation method to view another employee's schedule data
steps.expectedResult: Access is denied. System displays an error message indicating 'Access Denied' or 'You do not have permission to view this schedule'. Employee B's monthly schedule data is not displayed. Employee A remains on their own schedule view or is redirected to an error page. Security log records the unauthorized access attempt

postconditions: Employee A remains logged in with access only to their own schedule
Employee B's monthly schedule data remains protected and inaccessible to Employee A
System security logs record the access denial event
No unauthorized data exposure occurs

storyTitle: As Employee, I want the schedule interface to be responsive to use on mobile devices to achieve accessibility anytime

testCases.title: Validate responsive layout on mobile devices
preconditions: Employee has valid login credentials
Schedule interface is deployed and accessible
Smartphone device with modern browser (Chrome, Safari, Firefox) is available
Device has active internet connection
Test device screen size is between 320px - 480px width

steps.action: Open smartphone browser and navigate to the schedule interface URL
steps.expectedResult: Schedule login page loads and displays correctly on mobile screen

steps.action: Log in with valid employee credentials
steps.expectedResult: User is authenticated and schedule dashboard is displayed

steps.action: Observe the layout of the schedule interface on the smartphone screen
steps.expectedResult: Layout adjusts to screen size without horizontal scrolling, all elements are visible and properly aligned

steps.action: Navigate to different schedule views (daily, weekly, monthly)
steps.expectedResult: Each view adapts responsively to the mobile screen, maintaining readability and usability

steps.action: Access and use filter options (date range, department, employee)
steps.expectedResult: Filter controls are accessible, properly sized for touch interaction, and function correctly

steps.action: Scroll vertically and horizontally through the schedule content
steps.expectedResult: Scrolling is smooth, no content is cut off, and no unwanted horizontal scrolling occurs

steps.action: Tap on various interactive controls (buttons, dropdowns, date pickers)
steps.expectedResult: Controls respond accurately and promptly to touch input without delay or misregistration

steps.action: Test touch gestures such as swipe and pinch-to-zoom if applicable
steps.expectedResult: Touch gestures work as expected and enhance navigation experience

steps.action: Rotate device from portrait to landscape orientation
steps.expectedResult: Interface adapts seamlessly to orientation change, maintaining functionality and layout integrity

postconditions: User remains logged in to the schedule interface
No UI elements are broken or misaligned
All schedule data is displayed correctly
Session is active for further testing or normal use

testCases.title: Verify load times on mobile network
preconditions: Employee has valid login credentials
Mobile device is connected to 4G network (not WiFi)
Network speed testing tool or browser developer tools are available
Schedule interface is deployed and accessible
Browser cache is cleared before test execution

steps.action: Ensure mobile device is connected to 4G network and WiFi is disabled
steps.expectedResult: Device shows 4G/LTE connection indicator

steps.action: Clear browser cache and cookies
steps.expectedResult: Browser cache is empty, ensuring fresh page load

steps.action: Open browser developer tools or network monitoring tool to track load time
steps.expectedResult: Network monitoring tool is active and ready to record metrics

steps.action: Navigate to the schedule interface URL and start timer
steps.expectedResult: Page begins loading, network requests are initiated

steps.action: Wait for the page to fully load and become interactive
steps.expectedResult: Page loads completely within 5 seconds, all content is visible and interactive

steps.action: Record the total page load time from network monitoring tool
steps.expectedResult: Load time is documented and is under 5 seconds

steps.action: Log in with valid credentials and measure dashboard load time
steps.expectedResult: Schedule dashboard loads within 5 seconds after authentication

steps.action: Navigate to different schedule views and measure load times for each
steps.expectedResult: Each view transition completes within 5 seconds on 4G network

postconditions: Load time metrics are documented for analysis
User is logged into the schedule interface
Performance baseline is established for mobile network access
No performance degradation is observed

storyTitle: As Employee, I want to log out securely from the schedule system to protect my personal information

testCases.title: Validate secure logout process
preconditions: Employee has valid login credentials
Schedule system is accessible and operational
User is not currently logged in
Browser is open with no active sessions
Logout button is implemented and visible on all schedule pages

steps.action: Navigate to the schedule system login page
steps.expectedResult: Login page is displayed with username and password fields

steps.action: Enter valid employee credentials and click login button
steps.expectedResult: User is authenticated successfully

steps.action: Verify that the schedule dashboard is displayed
steps.expectedResult: Schedule dashboard loads with employee's schedule data visible

steps.action: Locate the logout button on the dashboard page
steps.expectedResult: Logout button is visible and accessible in the navigation area

steps.action: Click the logout button
steps.expectedResult: System initiates logout process, user session is terminated, and user is redirected to login page within 2 seconds

steps.action: Verify the current page is the login page
steps.expectedResult: Login page is displayed, indicating successful logout

steps.action: Click browser back button to attempt navigation to schedule dashboard
steps.expectedResult: Access is denied, user is redirected back to login page or shown access denied message

steps.action: Manually enter the schedule dashboard URL in the browser address bar
steps.expectedResult: System detects no active session, redirects to login page, and denies access to protected content

steps.action: Verify no error messages or session warnings are displayed
steps.expectedResult: Clean logout experience with appropriate messaging on login page

postconditions: User session is completely terminated
Authentication tokens are revoked
User cannot access protected pages without re-authentication
System is ready for new login
No residual session data remains active

testCases.title: Verify cached data clearance on logout
preconditions: Employee has valid login credentials
Schedule system is accessible
Browser developer tools are available for cache inspection
User is not currently logged in
Browser cache contains no previous session data

steps.action: Open browser developer tools and navigate to Application/Storage tab
steps.expectedResult: Developer tools are open and storage inspection is available

steps.action: Navigate to the schedule system login page and log in with valid credentials
steps.expectedResult: User is authenticated and schedule dashboard is displayed

steps.action: Navigate through multiple schedule views (daily, weekly, monthly) to generate cached data
steps.expectedResult: Schedule data for different views is loaded and displayed correctly

steps.action: Inspect browser cache, cookies, and local storage in developer tools
steps.expectedResult: Schedule data, session tokens, and cookies are present in browser storage

steps.action: Document the cached items including session tokens, cookies, and local storage entries
steps.expectedResult: List of cached data is recorded for comparison after logout

steps.action: Click the logout button
steps.expectedResult: User is logged out and redirected to login page within 2 seconds

steps.action: Immediately inspect browser cache, cookies, and local storage again
steps.expectedResult: Session-related cached data, authentication tokens, and cookies are cleared or invalidated

steps.action: Verify that session tokens and authentication cookies are removed
steps.expectedResult: No valid session tokens or authentication cookies remain in browser storage

steps.action: Log in again with the same credentials
steps.expectedResult: User is authenticated successfully with new session

steps.action: Observe the schedule data loading process
steps.expectedResult: Fresh schedule data is loaded from the server, not from cache, indicated by network requests in developer tools

steps.action: Verify new session tokens and cookies are created
steps.expectedResult: New authentication tokens and session cookies are present in browser storage, different from previous session

postconditions: All session-related cached data from previous session is cleared
New session is established with fresh authentication tokens
User has access to schedule with new session
No data leakage from previous session
System maintains security and privacy standards
